class.name: CFFI
class.brief_description: The global FFI type scope and entrypoint for opening libraries.

method.name: memcmp
method.description: Compares the first [param size_bytes] from [param s1] against [param s2]. If both [param s1] and [param s2] are [code]null[/code], returns [code]0[/code]. If only one of them is [code]null[/code] but the other is not, returns [code]1[/code]. If memory pointed to by [param s1] and [param s2] contains the same first [param size_bytes] bytes, returns [code]0[/code], otherwise returns the difference between the first two differing bytes.

method.name: memcpy
method.description: Copies [param size_bytes] bytes of memory from [param src] to [param dest]. If either [param src] or [param dest] is [code]null[/code], this function fails and returns [code]null[/code]. Otherwise, [param dest] is returned. [b]Warning:[/b] if memory pointed to by [param dest] and [param src] might overlap, use [method memmove] instead.

method.name: memequal
method.description: Compares the first [param size_bytes] from [param s1] against [param s2], returning whether memory pointed to by [param s1] and [param s2] contains the same first [param size_bytes] bytes.

method.name: memmove
method.description: Copies [param size_bytes] bytes of memory from [param src] to [param dest]. Memory pointed to by [param dest] and [param src] may overlap, the copy is always done in a non-destructive manner. If either [param src] or [param dest] is [code]null[/code], this function fails and returns [code]null[/code]. Otherwise, [param dest] is returned.

method.name: memset
method.description: Writes [param size_bytes] bytes of value [param byte_value] to [param dest]. If [param dest] is [code]null[/code], this function fails and returns [code]null[/code]. Otherwise, [param dest] is returned.

method.name: null_terminated_ascii_buffer
method.description: Similar to [method String.to_ascii_buffer], but adds a trailing null character so that the buffer is ready to be passed to C APIs that expect null-terminated strings.

method.name: null_terminated_utf8_buffer
method.description: Similar to [method String.to_utf8_buffer], but adds a trailing null character so that the buffer is ready to be passed to C APIs that expect null-terminated strings.

method.name: null_terminated_utf16_buffer
method.description: Similar to [method String.to_utf16_buffer], but adds a trailing null character so that the buffer is ready to be passed to C APIs that expect null-terminated strings.

method.name: null_terminated_utf32_buffer
method.description: Similar to [method String.to_utf32_buffer], but adds a trailing null character so that the buffer is ready to be passed to C APIs that expect null-terminated strings.

method.name: null_terminated_wchar_buffer
method.description: Similar to [method String.to_wchar_buffer], but adds a trailing null character so that the buffer is ready to be passed to C APIs that expect null-terminated strings.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens a native library by its name or file path. [param name_or_path] may be the name of the library, for example [code]"cffi"[/code], or a file path like [code]"res://some_dir/cffi.dll"[/code]. Paths starting with [code]res://[/code] reference files inside the project in editor. In built games, the directory part is ignored and the library is searched for in the executable path. Returns the open library handle or [code]null[/code] if the library could not be opened.
